hypothesis_content.title: Negative Macro Catalyst Amplification in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >55%), a negative US macroeconomic catalyst (e.g., weak jobs report, high CPI) will trigger a BTC price decline that is 1.8-2.5x larger than the average 4-hour move following similar catalysts over the past 90 days, as leveraged long positions are rapidly unwound.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often have elevated leverage as traders anticipate direction. Negative macro catalysts force rapid de-risking, amplifying the move. Recent news highlights job market concerns as a key macro catalyst for crypto.
entry_conditions: Negative US macro catalyst announced (jobs, CPI, PPI, retail sales)
BTC 15-minute candle closes >1.5% below pre-announcement price within 30 minutes of catalyst
Aggregated funding rates across major exchanges >0.01% (positive) prior to catalyst

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches -3.5% from entry OR 4-hour RSI(14) <25
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price returns to pre-catalyst level (+0.5% from entry)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 4-hour post-catalyst move is <1.5x the 90-day average for similar catalysts, or negative catalysts consistently fail to trigger liquidation cascades.
